intro: Laelia brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed orchid, is a species native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid with compact, upright growth and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that help it store water in its native, often arid environment. Laelia brevicaulis is well adapted to high altitudes and cool temperatures. It is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts due to its hardiness and attractive blooms.
